meanings.definition: A rude or offensive way of telling someone to go away or leave.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to deal with a group of rowdy fuckoffs disrupting the class.
meanings.sent2: The security guard quickly escorted the unruly fuckoffs out of the building.
meanings.sent3: The party was getting out of control, so the host had to kindly ask the fuckoffs to leave.
meanings.sent4: The manager had no choice but to kick out the troublemaking fuckoffs from the store.
meanings.sent5: The sign on the door clearly stated, 'No fuckoffs allowed.'

meanings.definition: A person who is annoying or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: I can't stand that guy; he's always such a negative fuckoffs.
meanings.sent2: The new coworker turned out to be a real lazy fuckoffs.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat was giving everyone a look as if to say, 'You're all a bunch of fuckoffs.'
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was being a real headache, a true little fuckoffs.
meanings.sent5: The annoying neighbor was the biggest fuckoffs in the entire neighborhood.
